TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ItemAutomationPeer extends System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer implements class System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IVirtualizedItemProvider

Docs.summary: Exposes a data item in an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection to [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](../../add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)].

remarks.format:
## Remarks Data items that are not also <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> types do not have children; however, they can have a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> tree and a corresponding [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](../../add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] tree.
For example, a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> can have a collection of strings that contain data items. When those items are processed by an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl> for visualization, a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> tree is created for them. This tree can have a corresponding [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](../../add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] tree. After the tree is created, [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](../../add/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] merges the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> tree into a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](../../add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] tree. ItemAutomationPeer works with its <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> counterpart, if it exists, to obtain more information about the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> tree.
Only visible data items, or more precisely, the corresponding <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> trees, have this dualism. Non-visible data items, which have no corresponding <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> trees, have only one ItemAutomationPeer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(object item, class System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemsControlAutomationPeer itemsControlAutomationPeer) cil managed

Docs.param: The data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.

The <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemsControlAutomationPeer"> that is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl> that holds the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection.
Docs.summary: Provides initialization for base class values when called by the constructor of a derived class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetAcceleratorKeyCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the accelerator key for the <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> that corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.
Docs.returns: The accelerator key.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAcceleratorKey%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetAccessKeyCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the access key for the <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> that corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.
Docs.returns: The access key.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAccessKey%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetAutomationIdCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the string that uniquely identifies the <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> that corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.
Docs.returns: A string that contains the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](../../add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] identifier.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](../../add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] identifier is the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AutomationId%2A> property. If the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AutomationId%2A> property is not set, the value is the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Name%2A> property.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationId%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Windows.Rect GetBoundingRectangleCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the <xref:System.Windows.Rect> that represents the bounding rectangle of the specified <xref:System.Windows.UIElement>.
Docs.returns: The bounding rectangle.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>. This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetBoundingRectangle%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.List`1<class System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> GetChildrenCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of child elements of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> that corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.
Docs.returns: The collection of child elements.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetChildren%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Windows.Point GetClickablePointCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a <xref:System.Windows.Point> that represents the clickable space that is on the specified <xref:System.Windows.UIElement>.
Docs.returns: The point that represents the clickable space that is on the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement">.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>. This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClickablePoint%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetHelpTextCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the string that describes the functionality of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> that corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.
Docs.returns: The help text.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetHelpText%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetItemStatusCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a string that conveys the visual status of the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement">.
Docs.returns: The status. Examples include "Busy" or "Online".

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>. This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetItemStatus%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetItemTypeCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a human-readable string that contains the type of item that the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> represents.
Docs.returns: The item type. An example includes "Mail Message" or "Contact".

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>. This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetItemType%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer GetLabeledByCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"> for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label> that is targeted to the specified <xref:System.Windows.UIElement>.
Docs.returns: The <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.LabelAutomationPeer"> for the element that is targeted by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>. This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLabeledBy%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetNameCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the text label of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> that corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.
Docs.returns: The text label.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can think of the name property as if it were a string of text that users use to explain which control they are referring to. Make certain that you have a textual representation for all controls in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gui](../../add/includes/tlasharptla-gui-md.md)] so that you can programmatically refer to the control in a localized manner.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetName%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationOrientation GetOrientationCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> is laid out in a particular direction.
Docs.returns: The direction of the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement">. Optionally, the method returns <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationOrientation> if the <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> is not laid out in a particular direction.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>. This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetOrientation%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance object GetPattern(valuetype System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface patternInterface) cil managed

Docs.param: An enumeration value that specifies the control pattern.
Docs.summary: Returns the object that supports the specified control pattern of the element that is associated with this automation peer.
Docs.returns: An object that supports the control pattern if is a supported value; otherwise, `null`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface?displayProperty=fullName> and the item is not in the visual tree, this method returns a `this` pointer. If equals <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface?displayProperty=fullName>, this method returns an object that implements the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISynchronizedInputProvider> interface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool HasKeyboardFocusCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> currently has keyboard input focus.
Docs.returns: `true` if the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> has keyboard input focus; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>. This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.HasKeyboardFocus%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool IsContentElementCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> contains data that is presented to the user.
Docs.returns: `true` if the element is a content element; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>. This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsContentElement%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool IsControlElementCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer> is understood by the end user as interactive.
Docs.returns: `true` if the element is a control; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection. The user might understand the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> as contributing to the logical structure of the control in the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_gui](../../add/includes/tla2sharptla-gui-md.md)]. This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsControlElement%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool IsEnabledCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> can receive and send events.
Docs.returns: `true` if the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](../../add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] peer can receive and send events; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>. This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsEnabled%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool IsKeyboardFocusableCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> can accept keyboard focus.
Docs.returns: `true` if the element can accept keyboard focus; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>. This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsKeyboardFocusable%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool IsOffscreenCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> is off the screen.
Docs.returns: `true` if the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> is not on the screen; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>. This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsOffscreen%2A>.
This method does not indicate whether the element is visible. In some circumstances, an element is on the screen but is still not visible. For example, if the element is obscured by other elements, it might not be visible. In this case, the method returns `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool IsPasswordCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> contains protected content.
Docs.returns: `true` if the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> contains protected content; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>. This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsPassword%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool IsRequiredForFormCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> is required to be completed on a form.
Docs.returns: `true` if the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> is required to be completed; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>. This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsRequiredForForm%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.

Gets the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemsControlAutomationPeer"> that is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl> that holds the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection.
Docs.value: The <see cref="T:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemsControlAutomationPeer"> that is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl> object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void SetFocusCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the keyboard input focus on the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement">. The <see cref="T:System.Windows.UIElement"> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.SetFocus%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IVirtualizedItemProvider.Realize() cil managed

Docs.summary: Makes the virtual item fully accessible as a UI Automation element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IVirtualizedItemProvider> interface.
